verses.text: \w Now|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w whole|strong="H3605"\w* world \w had|strong="H1961"\w* \w one|strong="H3605"\w* \w language|strong="H8193"\w* \w and|strong="H1697"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* common \w form|strong="H1961"\w* \w of|strong="H1697"\w* \w speech|strong="H8193"\w*.

\w And|strong="H7453"\w* they said \w to|strong="H1961"\w* \w one|strong="H1961"\w* \w another|strong="H7453"\w*, “\w Come|strong="H1961"\w*, \w let|strong="H1961"\w* \w us|strong="H3051"\w* \w make|strong="H3835"\w* \w bricks|strong="H3843"\w* \w and|strong="H7453"\w* bake \w them|strong="H8313"\w* \w thoroughly|strong="H8316"\w*.” \w So|strong="H1961"\w* they \w used|strong="H1961"\w* \w brick|strong="H3843"\w* instead \w of|strong="H2563"\w* stone, \w and|strong="H7453"\w* \w tar|strong="H2564"\w* instead \w of|strong="H2563"\w* \w mortar|strong="H2563"\w*.

Genealogy from Shem to Abram (1 Chronicles 1:17–27)

\w This|strong="H1121"\w* \w is|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w account|strong="H8435"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Shem|strong="H8035"\w*. \w Two|strong="H3967"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w after|strong="H8141"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w flood|strong="H3999"\w*, \w when|strong="H1121"\w* \w Shem|strong="H8035"\w* \w was|strong="H1121"\w* 100 \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H1121"\w*, \w he|strong="H8141"\w* \w became|strong="H3205"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* Arphaxad.

\w And|strong="H3967"\w* \w after|strong="H8141"\w* \w he|strong="H2568"\w* \w had|strong="H3205"\w* \w become|strong="H3205"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* Arphaxad, \w Shem|strong="H8035"\w* \w lived|strong="H2421"\w* 500 \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w and|strong="H3967"\w* \w had|strong="H3205"\w* \w other|strong="H3205"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w and|strong="H3967"\w* \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w*.

\w When|strong="H2421"\w* Arphaxad \w was|strong="H8141"\w* 35 \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H8141"\w*, \w he|strong="H2568"\w* \w became|strong="H3205"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H8141"\w* \w Shelah|strong="H7974"\w*.

\w And|strong="H3967"\w* \w after|strong="H8141"\w* \w he|strong="H8141"\w* \w had|strong="H3205"\w* \w become|strong="H3205"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Shelah|strong="H7974"\w*, Arphaxad \w lived|strong="H2421"\w* 403 \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w and|strong="H3967"\w* \w had|strong="H3205"\w* \w other|strong="H3205"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w and|strong="H3967"\w* \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w*.\f + \fr 11:13 \ft Hebrew; LXX (see also Luke 3:35–36) 12 When Arphaxad was 135 years old, he became the father of Cainan. 13 And after he had become the father of Cainan, Arphaxad lived 430 years and had other sons and daughters, and then he died. When Cainan had lived 130 years, he became the father of Shelah. And after he had become the father of Shelah, Cainan lived 330 years and had other sons and daughters. Note that LXX also adds 100 years to the ages of Shelah, Eber, Peleg, Reu, Serug, and Nahor in this genealogy.\f*

\w When|strong="H2421"\w* \w Shelah|strong="H7974"\w* \w was|strong="H8141"\w* 30 \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H8141"\w*, \w he|strong="H8141"\w* \w became|strong="H3205"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H8141"\w* \w Eber|strong="H5677"\w*.

Terah’s Descendants

This is \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w account|strong="H8435"\w* \w of|strong="H3205"\w* \w Terah|strong="H8646"\w*. \w Terah|strong="H8646"\w* \w became|strong="H3205"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H3205"\w* Abram, \w Nahor|strong="H5152"\w*, \w and|strong="H3205"\w* \w Haran|strong="H2039"\w*. \w And|strong="H3205"\w* \w Haran|strong="H2039"\w* \w became|strong="H3205"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H3205"\w* \w Lot|strong="H3876"\w*.

During \w his|strong="H6440"\w* father \w Terah|strong="H8646"\w*’s \w lifetime|strong="H6440"\w*, \w Haran|strong="H2039"\w* \w died|strong="H4191"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w his|strong="H6440"\w* \w native|strong="H4138"\w* \w land|strong="H6440"\w*, \w in|strong="H5921"\w* Ur \w of|strong="H6440"\w* \w the|strong="H6440"\w* \w Chaldeans|strong="H3778"\w*.

\w And|strong="H1323"\w* Abram \w and|strong="H1323"\w* \w Nahor|strong="H5152"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* wives \w for|strong="H8034"\w* themselves. Abram’s wife \w was|strong="H8034"\w* \w named|strong="H8034"\w* \w Sarai|strong="H8297"\w*, \w and|strong="H1323"\w* \w Nahor|strong="H5152"\w*’s wife \w was|strong="H8034"\w* \w named|strong="H8034"\w* \w Milcah|strong="H4435"\w*; she \w was|strong="H8034"\w* \w the|strong="H3947"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* \w of|strong="H1323"\w* \w Haran|strong="H2039"\w*, \w who|strong="H1323"\w* \w was|strong="H8034"\w* \w the|strong="H3947"\w* father \w of|strong="H1323"\w* both \w Milcah|strong="H4435"\w* \w and|strong="H1323"\w* \w Iscah|strong="H3252"\w*.
\w But|strong="H1961"\w* \w Sarai|strong="H8297"\w* \w was|strong="H1961"\w* \w barren|strong="H6135"\w*; she \w had|strong="H1961"\w* \w no|strong="H1961"\w* \w children|strong="H2056"\w*.

\w And|strong="H1121"\w* \w Terah|strong="H8646"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w his|strong="H3947"\w* \w son|strong="H1121"\w* Abram, \w his|strong="H3947"\w* \w grandson|strong="H1121"\w* \w Lot|strong="H3876"\w* \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Haran|strong="H2771"\w*, \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w his|strong="H3947"\w* \w daughter-in-law|strong="H3618"\w* \w Sarai|strong="H8297"\w* \w the|strong="H3947"\w* wife \w of|strong="H1121"\w* Abram, \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w they|strong="H8033"\w* \w set|strong="H3427"\w* \w out|strong="H3318"\w* \w from|strong="H3318"\w* Ur \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H3947"\w* \w Chaldeans|strong="H3778"\w* \w for|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H3947"\w* land \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Canaan|strong="H3667"\w*. \w But|strong="H3947"\w* \w when|strong="H3318"\w* \w they|strong="H8033"\w* arrived \w in|strong="H3427"\w* \w Haran|strong="H2771"\w*, \w they|strong="H8033"\w* \w settled|strong="H3427"\w* \w there|strong="H8033"\w*.

\w Terah|strong="H8646"\w* \w lived|strong="H1961"\w* 205 \w years|strong="H8141"\w*, \w and|strong="H3967"\w* \w he|strong="H3117"\w* \w died|strong="H4191"\w* \w in|strong="H8141"\w* \w Haran|strong="H2771"\w*.
